title: why was the butcher urgot skin changed?
body: Not that the new one is bad, just that compared to the original I wouldn't have bought this one. I've sent a report to riot support and they said they couldn't help me or get in contact with the design team. If anyone knows a person to contact that may have the ability to revert the changes I would be interested in having that info. Also what does everyone else think of riot changing old skins? Is it fair to the people who bought the original?

replies.body:
Hey D A V I 5 - 

We do update skins and champions as they get older. We did a ton of texture rebalances last year, Butcher Urgot being one of the affected skins. 

As **Ququroon** mentioned during these rebalances:

*"We're looking to address the fact that many of League's older champion and skins were created using the Rift's current look and color palette (or even older ones), which continues to evolve over time. At this point, many champion and skin textures need a bit of rebalancing to ensure they look nice regardless of where they're standing, or who they're standing next to. We're talking just about every champion and skin released before 2013 (with a few outliers)." *

We aren't reverting these texture updates, as they were intended for the reasons stated above. 

As a side note, the **[terms of use](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse)**, also known as the fine print that no one really looks at, but agrees to, states the following: 

"*You further acknowledge and agree that Riot Games has the right, but not the obligation, to delete, **alter**, move, remove, or transfer any and all Game Assets, in whole or in part, at any time and for any reason, with or without notice to you, and with no liability of any kind to you.".*

Hope this answers your question. If you have anything else, feel to ask. ^-^
Yeah, not going to say I'm to happy with the reply but it answers my question.  Thank you for responding quickly.
Of course. If you have questions, always feel free to post on the boards. We'll do our best to answer them!

i think he was talking about the splash art so lemme answer for him, Chinese splash art, not permanent, Urgot is high on the list for a VGU next year = new splash arts
Correct - larger updates do receive new splashes - just like Tristana, Poppy, Taric and Shen did. :)

I'm going to drop in and say that out of the few splash art changes that affected my champion/skin pool, this was one I didn't like.

The Karthus base splash change I was apathetic to, the Irelia change felt so great, the Statue of Karthus change felt kind of bad, and the Butcher Urgot change felt _really_ bad.

I'm really looking forward to when he gets his splash arts updated.
